page.title: 18CHANGE IN WILLINGDON
page.content: The Church Hall (built 1853) in Church Street was the Village School until a new Primary School was built in Rapsons Road in 1952, also a Secondary School in Broad Road. Lower Willingdon had expanded in this period. The majority of children now live there, or in Polegate. The Verger's House, adjoining the Church Hall, was the headmaster's house. The Primary School in Rapsons Road was built on the site of a First World War Airship Station. An engineering works next to the library in Coppice Avenue remains from this; also, at Donkey Hollow, a massive concrete slab with iron ring for tethering airships. ( not donkeys! ) Haystoun House in Church Street was originally a large private house. It then became a home for the elderly. It is now a block of flats.
